TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed BufferModeSettings extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Configures the ASP.NET event-buffering settings for event providers. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The BufferModeSettings class is used to define roles for event providers, such as Critical, Notification, Analysis, and Logging. Each role would buffer events differently, as appropriate for that role. For example a Critical role would keep the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxBufferSize%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxFlushSize%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.UrgentFlushInterval%2A> properties small, whereas an Analysis role would set those properties to higher values.
This class corresponds to the `bufferModes` configuration-file element.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for several properties of the BufferModeSettings class.
``` <healthMonitoring> <bufferModes> <add name="Critical Notification" maxBufferSize="100" maxFlushSize="20" urgentFlushThreshold="1" regularFlushInterval="Infinite" urgentFlushInterval="00:01:00" maxBufferThreads="1" /> <add name="Notification" maxBufferSize="300" maxFlushSize="20" urgentFlushThreshold="1" regularFlushInterval="Infinite" urgentFlushInterval="00:01:00" maxBufferThreads="1" /> <add name="Analysis" maxBufferSize="1000" maxFlushSize="100" urgentFlushThreshold="100" regularFlushInterval="00:05:00" urgentFlushInterval="00:01:00" maxBufferThreads="1" /> <add name="Logging" maxBufferSize="1000" maxFlushSize="200" urgentFlushThreshold="800" regularFlushInterval="00:30:00" urgentFlushInterval="00:05:00" maxBufferThreads="1" /> </bufferModes> </healthMonitoring> ```

MemberSignature.Value: public BufferModeSettings (string name, int maxBufferSize, int maxFlushSize, int urgentFlushThreshold, TimeSpan regularFlushInterval, TimeSpan urgentFlushInterval, int maxBufferThreads);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, int32 maxBufferSize, int32 maxFlushSize, int32 urgentFlushThreshold, valuetype System.TimeSpan regularFlushInterval, valuetype System.TimeSpan urgentFlushInterval, int32 maxBufferThreads) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the object being created.
The maximum number of events buffered at one time. The value must be greater than zero.
The maximum number of events per buffer flush. Must be greater than zero.
The number of events buffered before a buffer flush is triggered. The value must be greater than zero and less than or equal to `maxBufferSize`.
The standard amount of time between buffer flushes. The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32> ticks.
The minimum length of time that can pass between buffer flushes. The value must be less than or equal to `regularFlushInterval`.
The maximum number of buffer-flushing threads that can be active at one time.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using specified settings.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the BufferModeSettings constructor. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/32496253-e371-44fd-9d57-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/32496253-e371-44fd-9d57-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of events that can be buffered at one time.
Docs.value: The maximum number of events that can be buffered at one time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the MaxBufferSize property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#16](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_330_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#16](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_330_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of flushing threads that can be active at one time.
Docs.value: The maximum number of flushing threads that can be active at one time. The default is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of events per flush.
Docs.value: The maximum number of events per flush.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object.
Docs.value: The name of the object. The default value is an empty string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A unique name is required.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxBufferSize%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time between buffer flushes.
Docs.value: The regular amount of time between buffer flushes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue> ticks. Invalid values may cause an exception when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxBufferSize%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#19](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_314_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#19](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_314_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum amount of time that can pass between buffer flushes.
Docs.value: The minimum amount of time that can pass between buffer flushes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero and less than or equal to the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.RegularFlushInterval%2A> property. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of events that can be buffered before a flush is triggered.
Docs.value: The number of events that can be buffered before a flush is triggered.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero and less than or equal to the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxBufferSize%2A> property. Invalid values may cause an exception when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
